page.title: 16GLADESTRY CHURCH
page.content: Our church belongs to the Church in Wales. It was founded by King Harold who was killed at the Battle of Hastings in 1066. It is dedicated to St Mary. Some of the walls may date back to the eleventh century, but most of it is thirteenth century. The roof is very old. It has stone tiles. The tower has a pyramid spire. There are five bells, but they can't be rung. The Rector is Steven Prior. He is an American. He doesn't live in Gladestry but in New Radnor. There are services nearly every Sunday. Not many people go, only about 10 or 20, and hardly any young people go. A lot more people go at Christmas and at Easter, and for weddings, baptisms, and funerals. There are always a lot of people at Harvest Festivals. The Rector comes to our school because it is a Church in Wales school.
